p: The collection ( Table 1) of the basal rosettes of H. radicata and H. radiata was carried out at 1157 m a.s.l. in the area of the Aspromonte Massif known as “Cucullaro” (38.171987° N–15.815650° E), a mountain resort in the municipality of Santo Stefano in Aspromonte. The collection of the basal rosettes of H. lucida subsp. taurina was carried out in the municipality of Scilla (40 m a.s.l., 38.253987° N–15.716493° E), while those of H. laevigata at the mountain resort of Trepitò, located at 952 m a.s.l. (38.284906° N–16.046640° E) in the municipality of Molochio. The collection of the basal rosettes was carried out before flower stem development, as traditionally these and similar plants are collected by local people in this way [ 8, 19]. All the collection sites are located in the province of Reggio Calabria (South Italy)
